snippet: Some of the heaviest fighting yet in Damascus erupted southwest of the city center, while diplomatic efforts seemed on track to run into renewed Russian resistance.
abstract: Some of the heaviest fighting yet in Syria erupts in Damascus, while diplomatic efforts seem on track to run into renewed Russian resistance; fighting rages as obstacles to forge a united international front to enforce a cease-fire appear immovable, with Russia criticizing what it calls Western efforts to 'blackmail' it into threatening the government of Pres Bashar al-Assad with United Nations sanctions.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Dalal Mawad from Beirut, Lebanon; an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria; Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow; Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva; Alan Cowell from London; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Some of the heaviest fighting yet in Damascus erupted southwest of the city center, while diplomatic efforts seemed on track to run into renewed Russian resistance.

headline.seo: Fighting Spreads in Damascus; Russia Resists Pressuring Syria
